definition: to make trouble out of nothing
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: The moral to this story is, "Don't make much ado about nothing."
sentences.chinese: 這個故事的道德是，“不要無事生非。”

sentences.english: "Much Ado About Nothing" is a good example of a Shakespearian comedy.
sentences.chinese: 《無事生非》是莎士比亞喜劇的一個範例。

sentences.english: The whole controversy is far too much ado about absolutely nothing.
sentences.chinese: 整個爭議完全是無事生非。

definition: it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
red in the face/extremely angry
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
video program
idle gossip
dizzy and light-headed
a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to force someone to do something
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
